1. Start with a story: Open the pitch with a compelling, personal story that illustrates the problem international students face when searching for housing. This will create an emotional connection with the audience and make them more invested in your solution.
2. Highlight competitive advantages: Clearly outline the unique selling points that differentiate Cortado from other housing providers. Discuss any proprietary technology, exclusive partnerships, or other factors that set your company apart from the competition.
3. Showcase customer testimonials: Include quotes or short case studies from satisfied customers, such as students who have used Cortado's services and had positive experiences. This will help build trust and credibility with potential investors.
4. Discuss potential risks and mitigation strategies: Address any potential risks or challenges associated with scaling your business and outline the strategies you have in place to mitigate them. This will show investors that you have considered various scenarios and have a plan for navigating potential obstacles.
5. Visual aids: Enhance your pitch with visually appealing slides, charts, and graphs that help convey your message more effectively. Make sure your visuals are clear, simple, and easy to understand, without overwhelming the audience with too much information.
6. Include financial projections: Provide a brief overview of your financial projections, including expected revenue growth, profitability, and cash flow. This will help investors understand the potential returns on their investment and the overall financial health of your company.
7. Address team qualifications: Introduce your team members and highlight their relevant experience and expertise. This will demonstrate that you have a capable and knowledgeable team in place to execute your business plan.
8. Clearly state your ask: Be direct and specific about the amount of funding you are seeking and the terms of the investment. Also, discuss how the funds will be used and the milestones you aim to achieve with the investment.
9. Practice and rehearse: Deliver your pitch with confidence and enthusiasm. Practice your presentation multiple times to ensure you can speak naturally and fluently, making eye contact with your audience and engaging them throughout the pitch.
